doc:
Graham Haberfield https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Graham_Haberfield 0 Graham Haberfield (17 November 1941 - 18 October 1975) was an English actor. Born in Chesterfield, Derbyshire, the son of a railway porter, he was educated at Herbert Strutt Grammar School, Belper. Later, he joined the Bristol Old Vic Theatre, from where he graduated in 1962. The same year, at the age of 20, he joined the cast of Coronation Street as Jerry Booth, a character who appeared between 1962–1964, 1965–1968 and 1971–1975. His sporadic appearances allowed him to try other work and avoid being typecast. He did varied stage and television work, such as No Hiding Place, Strange Report, and Z-Cars, but is best remembered as Jerry Booth and as Winston, the die-hard Manchester City fan in the hit Granada Television sitcom The Dustbinmen. Graham_Haberfield ( 17_November_1941 - 18_October_1975 ) was an_English_actor . Born in Chesterfield , Derbyshire , the_son of a_railway_porter , he was_educated at Herbert_Strutt_Grammar_School , Belper . Later , he joined the_Bristol_Old_Vic_Theatre , from where he graduated in 1962 . The_same_year , at the_age of 20 , he joined the_cast of Coronation_Street as Jerry_Booth , a_character who appeared between 1962 – 1964_,_1965 – 1968_and_1971 – 1975 . His_sporadic_appearances allowed him to_try other_work and avoid being_typecast . He did varied_stage_and_television_work , such_as No_Hiding_Place , Strange_Report , and Z-Cars , but is_best_remembered as Jerry_Booth and as Winston , the_die-hard_Manchester_City_fan in the_hit_Granada_Television_sitcom The_Dustbinmen .
